head.title: Paths for America, Other Than War

hedline.hl1: Paths for America, Other Than War

abstract.p: Arthur Smith lettercalls for work on space-based solar power as renewable energy source for US (S)

block.p: Thomas L. Friedman (column, Oct. 6) argues that we need something on the scale of the Manhattan Project to develop a renewable energy source and strengthen America. There is such a project ready and just waiting for sufficient support: space-based solar power.

The idea dates back to the 1960's, but recent developments imply it will be a very cost-effective, completely renewable and unlimited energy solution once the initial investment on the order of $150 billion is completed.

Thomas L. Friedman (column, Oct. 6) argues that we need something on the scale of the Manhattan Project to develop a renewable energy source and strengthen America. There is such a project ready and just waiting for sufficient support: space-based solar power.

The idea dates back to the 1960's, but recent developments imply it will be a very cost-effective, completely renewable and unlimited energy solution once the initial investment on the order of $150 billion is completed.
Are we still capable of the greatness that produced the Manhattan and Apollo projects, the major hydroelectric dams and our Interstate highway infrastructure?
Both parties should support this project, which is the only long-term road to true energy independence for our country.
